definition: to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: The mother is not good at words, always well towards our smile.
sentences.chinese: 船娘不擅言辞，总是呵呵地朝着我们笑。

sentences.english: He said her actions speak louder than her words; she's never kept a promise.
sentences.chinese: 他说她的行动胜于言辞，可她从不守诺。

sentences.english: Polite verbalism is the respect to others.
sentences.chinese: 礼貌的言辞是对别人的尊重。

sentences.english: For example, unwelcome sexual comments, jokes, innuendoes.
sentences.chinese: 例如，不受欢迎的性言辞，笑话，提示。

sentences.english: You can use them mainly to soften your speech.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用它们来柔化你的言辞。

sentences.english: She can describe an ostrich or elephant with equal felicity.
sentences.chinese: 她可以用同样巧妙的言辞，描写驼鸟和大象。
他的虚夸的言辞并非新鲜。

sentences.english: On hearing his silly words, I went snickering.
sentences.chinese: 听了他无聊的言辞，我忍不住走开了。

sentences.english: Bellicose rhetoric most often serves as an excuse for inaction.
sentences.chinese: 好斗的言辞常常是无所作为的借口。

sentences.english: His words was a breach upon kingly power.
sentences.chinese: 他的言辞是对王权的侵犯。

sentences.english: The politician could never speak simply; she was always grandiloquent.
sentences.chinese: 这位政治家从来不会简单地说话，她总是言辞夸张。

sentences.english: On the court, the one's words of plaintiff attorney Si Daolan won enthusiastic applause.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上，原告律师斯道兰的言辞赢得了热烈的掌声。

sentences.english: I pristine father and brother, always ineloquent.
sentences.chinese: 我质朴的父兄，向来不善言辞。

sentences.english: Actor and comedian Gilbert Gottfried was fired by Aflac after tweeting jokes about the earthquake and tsunami in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 一位喜剧演员因为对日本地震的不敬言辞被炒了鱿鱼。

sentences.english: Its verbal expression was very clear.
In using such class-war rhetoric, Mr Thaksin is playing with fire.
sentences.chinese: 使用这种阶级对抗的言辞，他信是在玩火。

wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction

words and actions/what one says and what one does
